arm_group.description: Patients having surgery for a meniscal tear.

brief_summary.textblock:
PURPOSE: To investigate the natural time course of patient-reported outcomes after meniscus
      surgery and identify factors associated with good and bad outcome after surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Assigned for arthroscopy on suspicion of a medial and/or lateral meniscus tear.

          -  Age >18 years at time of recruitment

          -  Having an email address

          -  Able to read and understand Danish

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who will or have previously undergone surgical reconstruction of the
             anterior or posterior cruciate ligament (ACL or PCL) in either knee

          -  Fracture to the lower extremities (i.e. hip, leg or foot) in either leg within the
             last 6 months prior to recruitment

          -  Not mentally able to reply to the questionnaire

study_pop.textblock:
Patients assigned for arthroscopy on suspicion of a meniscus tear in the period from
        February 1st 2013 to January 31st 2014 will be consecutively recruited to the KACS cohort
        from 4 different hospitals (Lillebaelt Hospital - Kolding and Vejle and Odense University
        Hospital - Odense and Svendborg) in the Region of Southern Denmark.

intervention.description: Surgery to the meniscus - resection or repair.

facility.name: Department of Orthopedics and Traumatology, Odense University Hospital
Department of Orthopedics and Traumatology, Odense University Hospital

other_outcome.description: Questions regarding global perceived effect (GPE) to explore minimal clinical important change in patient-reported outcomes.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Sports Science and Clinical Biomechanics, University of Southern Denmark

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Regional Scientific Ethical Committee for South Denmark

primary_outcome.description: Knee specific questionnaire. All domains on the KOOS. Primary end point is change from PRE surgery (assessed 1-14 days prior to surgery) to 52 weeks follow-up.
primary_outcome.measure: Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: PRE surgery (assessed 1-14 days prior to surgery) and at 12 weeks and 52 weeks follow-up

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study 36-Item Short Form Health Survey (SF-36)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PRE surgery (assessed 1-14 days prior to surgery) and at 12 weeks and 52 weeks follow-up.

secondary_outcome.description: Dichotomous outcome (y/n) to the question: "Considering your knee function, do you feel that your current state is satisfactory? With knee function you should take into account all activities you have during your daily life, sport and recreational activities, your level of pain and other symptoms, and also your knee related quality of life".

Patients replying "no" to the PASS question will also be asked to answer (y/n) the following question: "Would you consider your current state as being so unsatisfactory that you think the treatment has failed?". Patients replying, "yes" to the second question will be defined as experiencing "treatment failure" (TF).

collaborator.agency: Department of Orthopedics and Traumatology, Odense University Hospital, Odense, Denmark
Department of Orthopedics and Traumatology, Odense University Hospital, Svendborg, Denmark.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
